components.description:
An icon representing vibration mode on a mobile phone, indicating that a phone should be switched to silent and/or vibrate mode.

Displayed as a phone with either zig-zag lines or muted-bell icon on most platforms. Early versions of this emoji often used a heart alongside a mobile phone, as commonly seen in Japan.
components.title: Vibration Mode

description:
An icon representing vibration mode on a mobile phone, indicating that a phone should be switched to silent and/or vibrate mode.

Displayed as a phone with either zig-zag lines or muted-bell icon on most platforms. Early versions of this emoji often used a heart alongside a mobile phone, as commonly seen in Japan.
title: Vibration Mode

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Communication symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: An icon representing vibration mode on a mobile phone, usedÂ as aÂ silent alternative to notification sounds. Appears like a phone with a hear http://emojipedia.org/vibration-mode/

bn:00110624a: Free from sound or noise; absolutely still; perfectly quiet.
Marked by the complete lack of sound or noise.

bn:00084387v: To telephone, to call someone on the telephone.
To contact someone using the telephone.
Get or try to get into communication (with someone) by telephone
To contact someone by dialing his or her telephone number; to make someone's telephone ring using one's own telephone.

bn:00095533v: Shake, quiver, or throb; move back and forth rapidly, usually in an uncontrolled manner
To move with small movements rapidly to and fro.

bn:00017029n: A portable electronic device used for calling people.
A field that contains a contact's mobile phone number.
A mobile phone using any technology (such as PCS).
A button in the Options dialog box, on the Phones tab, that the user clicks to enter his or her mobile phone number.
A form of videotelephony that can convey simultaneous audio and video, or
A portable, wireless telephone, which changes antenna connections seamlessly during travel from one radio reception cell to another without losing the party-to-party call connection.
A portable telephone that connects with the telephone network over radio wave transmission.
Portable device to make telephone calls using a radio link
A handheld portable telephone that operates through a radio network.
A mobile phone is a phone that can make and receive telephone calls over a radio link while moving around a wide geographic area.
The link to the Windows Live site where users can register their mobile phone and find information about the Windows Live for Mobile services.
A hand-held mobile radiotelephone for use in an area divided into small sections, each with its own short-range transmitter/receiver

bn:00062020n: An item the user can select in the Options dialog box, Phones tab, from the "Select the default device for calling phone numbers" drop-down list. When the user selects Phone as the default device for calling phone numbers, Communicator uses the PBX phone integrated with Communicator for making a call.
An electronic device used for two-way talking with other people (often shortened to phone).
A telephone, or phone, is a telecommunications device that permits two or more users to conduct a conversation when they are not in the same vicinity of each other to be heard directly.
A traditional phone, which has a wired connection (as opposed to a mobile phone).
An electronic device used for two-way talking with other people.
An electronic device used for calling people.
A device for transmitting conversations and other sounds in real time across distances.
Electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds
Also known as "the horn", especially among soldiers and police officers

apple_vendor_description: Apple's vibration mode emoji is a sleek, minimalist representation of a smartphone icon, distinctively designed for Apple devices.  It features a smooth, darkened rectangle with a subtle, almost imperceptible gradient, evoking the quiet power of silent notifications.  The soft, rounded edges are a hallmark of Apple's aesthetic, communicating a sense of modern functionality and discretion, perfect for indicating that your device is set to vibrate on Apple devices.
